message_1: Suppose we have the Caesar cipher with a shift of 7. Encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using this cipher.
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using the Caesar cipher with a shift of 7, we will shift each letter in the message 7 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter goes beyond 'Z', we will wrap around back to 'A'. 

Here's the encryption process for each letter:

M -> T
A -> H
T -> A
H -> O
E -> L
M -> T
A -> H
T -> A
I -> P
C -> J
S -> Z

The encrypted message is "THAOLTAHPJZ".
